intro: Phacelia cordifolia, commonly known as heartleaf phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, sky-blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its hairy stems and showy blooms. Phacelia cordifolia is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
